newsitem.title: USA: Brent crude climbs in late U.S. cash trading.
newsitem.headline: Brent crude climbs in late U.S. cash trading.

text.p: North Sea Brent crude climbed in late U.S. cash trading on Monday, traders said.
A Wall Street trader picked up four full September cargoes between $18.50 and $18.53 a barrel, as well as a partial cargo at $18.52 a barrel.
An August boat also changed hands at $18.65 a barrel.
September Brent closed at $18.42 on London's IPE.
Intermonth spreads were quiet, with one September/October spread trading at minus five cents.
August/September was pegged at plus 13/15 cents, September/October at minus seven to five cents and October/November at minus 12 to nine cents.
